snippet: The initial sense of satisfaction and self-congratulation following the lifetime ban issued to the Los Angeles Clippers’ owner has given way to pragmatism.
abstract: William C Rhoden Sports of The Times column holds that the initial sense of satisfaction and self-congratulation following NBA's lifetime ban issued to Los Angeles Clippers owner Donald Sterling has given way to pragmatism; notes that NBA commissioner Adam Silver has many complicated matters to decide, including labor issues, television contracts and player discipline.
lead_paragraph: The initial sense of satisfaction and self-congratulation following the lifetime ban issued to the Los Angeles Clippers’ owner has given way to pragmatism.

headline.main: Calm in the N.B.A. After the Sterling Storm
